div1.p: [Randin] sends Hench the photos he requested from Pedro Machado. He is happy to help with Hench's work, which recognizes the contributions of Finlay.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from [J. Randin] to Philip Showalter Hench, January 16, 1942 See Spanish original.
div1.opener:
Military City - Barracks “Cabo Parrado”
January 16, 1942
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Esteemed Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I have the pleasure of sending with this letter the two
photographs that you requested from Dr. Pedro L. Machado, in your letter
of November 24 of last year. Doctor Machado has sent me the letter
(referred to) in order that I might send them to you since it is more
practical for me to send them.

Same as I
for from Ara

I have true pleasure in contributing in some form to the good
work of publication that you are doing: “The Conquerors of Yellow
Fever” where the great fame of my compatriot, Dr. Carlos Finlay, is
being recognized and of those distinguished official American doctors
who formed the commission that verified his discovery.

Enchanted in being able to do something useful I remain
at your orders, your colleague and friend
